item.title: Google Cloud Print: It's Actually Awesome, and Here's How to Set It Up
item.description:
Google Cloud Print: It's Actually Awesome, and Here's How to Set It Up:
... http://t.co/OLwVX1oo <~ [Blogpost]
item.content:encoded: Google Cloud Print: It's Actually Awesome, and Here's How to Set It Up: ... http://t.co/OLwVX1oo <~ [Blogpost] Google Cloud Print is an under-appreciated service that can send print jobs from virtually anywhere to a connected printer in any other location. Normally that involves tedious configuration on your network, but Cloud Print can do it in just a few minutes. It's really easy to set up, and there are a few things you can do to extend its support beyond the browser to make all your printing tasks a lot easier. Here's a look at what it can do, how you can set it up, and how to make it even better. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: lifehacker.com

item.title: Susan G. Komen Apologizes for Cutting Off Planned Parenthood Funding - ABC News
item.description: Susan G. Komen apologizes, backtracks: http://t.co/4qbUSLbs
item.content:encoded: Susan G. Komen apologizes, backtracks: http://t.co/4qbUSLbs (Image Credit: Karen Bleier / AFP / Getty Images) The Susan G. Komen for the Cure foundation apologized today for cutting off funding from Planned Parenthood and vowed to revise the policy that led to an intense backlash against the nation’s largest breast cancer organization. “We want to apologize to the American public for recent decisions that cast doubt upon our commitment to our mission of saving women’s lives,” president and founder Nancy Brinker said in a statement today. “We have been distressed at the presumption that the changes made to our funding criteria were done for political reasons… Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com

item.title: Bake an Egg in an Avocado for a Fast and Healthy Breakfast Treat
item.description: Bake an Egg in an Avocado for a Fast and Healthy Breakfast Treat [Food Hacks] http://t.co/9f1cL5EQ
item.content:encoded: Bake an Egg in an Avocado for a Fast and Healthy Breakfast Treat [Food Hacks] http://t.co/9f1cL5EQ Avocados are amazing things—they're delicious on their own, but they also have a lot of healthy fats, dietary fibers, and vitamins, and despite their high caloric value, they're remarkably easy to prepare. If you have an avocado that's too firm to use for something else, or you're just in the mood for something new and healthy for breakfast, slice it in half, remove the pit, and carve out a little space in the center. Crack an egg where the pit was, and bake. In a few minutes, you'll have a delicious, protein and vitamin-packed breakfast treat that's rich enough to keep you going all morning. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: lifehacker.com
